Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of seven (?) lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393249) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393249)
